snippet: Starting with a wave of layoffs last Monday, and despite union advertising, Gov. Dannel P. Malloy has focused on trimming overhead as taxable personal income has declined.
abstract: Gov Dannel P Malloy of Connecticut defends cuts to jobs and expenses as he attempts to make up $922 million budget shortfall; total of 262 state workers have lost their jobs in single week; Malloy says state faces new economic reality, and that raising taxes on wealthy would only further risk chasing them out of state.
lead_paragraph: Starting with a wave of layoffs last Monday, and despite union advertising, Gov. Dannel P. Malloy has focused on trimming overhead as taxable personal income has declined.

headline.main: Connecticut Chooses to Cut Jobs Over Increased Taxes in Budget Crisis
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Cuts Jobs but Avoids Tax Increase in State Budget Crisis
